title: Cardev Filter Replacement (Main / Aux System)
purpose: Replace the Cardev hydraulic filter on the main or auxiliary hydraulic system.
Prevent oil contamination and maintain hydraulic system performance.
safety: Ensure the hydraulic system is depressurised before opening the filter housing.
Do not open the Cardev filter unless the associated compensator is fully drained.
Wear gloves and eye protection to prevent oil exposure.

steps.title: Identify system
text: Identify which hydraulic system the Cardev filter will be replaced on.
Confirm whether the filter is connected to the main or auxiliary system.

steps.title: Drain hydraulic system
text: Drain oil from the selected hydraulic system.
For auxiliary system only: connect the vacuum hose to the return port at the front of the ROV.
Start the vacuum pump.

steps.title: Confirm compensator is drained
text: Observe the compensator for the selected system while draining.
When the compensator spring is fully extended, slightly open the relief valve to allow air to push remaining hydraulic oil out.

steps.title: Open Cardev filter housing
text: Ensure no more oil is draining, then stop the vacuum pump.
Using a 27 mm spanner, loosen the Cardev filter lid by turning it counter-clockwise.
notes: Do not open the filter housing if the compensator is not fully drained. Failure to do so will result in an oil spill.

steps.title: Remove used filter
text: Remove the used Cardev filter by pulling upward on the two lifting slings.
If the filter is difficult to remove due to expansion, use a flat screwdriver to gently compress the filter while pulling it free.
Avoid damaging the Cardev filter housing.

steps.title: Flush filter housing
text: Fill the filter housing with approximately 1 inch of clean hydraulic oil.
Start the vacuum pump to flush contaminated oil from the housing.
Stop the vacuum pump once the oil has drained.

steps.title: Install new filter
text: Remove the plastic packaging from the new Cardev filter.
Install the new filter into the housing.
Prime the filter by filling it with clean hydraulic oil until fully saturated.

steps.title: Fit lid and torque
text: Lubricate the new O-ring seal and install it onto the filter lid.
Refit the lid and torque to 50 Nm.

steps.title: Refill and bleed system
text: Refill the selected hydraulic system.
Confirm oil level via communications with the control room.
Bleed the system using the Cardev and compensator bleed ports.
Run the system and remove any remaining air.
Top up oil level if required after operation.

steps.title: Dispose of used filter
text: Leave the used Cardev filter on a drain until oil stops dripping.
Place the filter in a plastic bag and dispose of it in the designated filter waste bin.

notes: This procedure applies to both main and auxiliary hydraulic systems on Kystdesign ROVs.
Replacement filters for Edda Freya are stored on the top rack beside the hydraulic room.
